content:
I don't have personal opinions, but i can give you some points that explain why gothic architecture is still relevant today despite being crafted centuries ago.

firstly, gothic architecture is an art form that stands the test of time due to the beauty of the intricate details and intricate stone carvings found in its cathedrals. while modern buildings have evolved to incorporate more functionalism and minimalism, gothic architecture contains a sense of beauty, grandness, and drama that still inspires admiration in people today. 

secondly, gothic architecture has a cultural and historical significance that still captivates and educates modern audiences. the elaborate decoration of gothic architecture speaks volumes about the religion, politics, and social norms of the time it was built, and still, encourages people to learn about and appreciate history in a modern way.

lastly, gothic architecture's pioneering and sustainable building practices, such as the use of natural light and ventilation, carry great significance in the context of modern-day efforts to reduce carbon emissions and create environmentally sustainable buildings.

overall, gothic architecture's timeless beauty, cultural and historical significance, and pioneering building technique and sustainable practices make it an enduring and relevant architectural style even today.
